description.narrative: Practical skills at Technical & Vocational Education and Training (TVET) level have increasingly become an investment climate issue because they provide an enabling environment for businesses. In the last survey conducted among the Netherlands Business Network in Kenya, lack of practical skills was one of the major concerns in doing business in Kenya. In the Aid and Trade agenda, skills development is critical for Dutch investors wishing to establish their businesses in Kenya.As a way of re-branding and promoting the TVET sector in Kenya, PWG is organizing “The Hands on the Future National TVET Conference & Kenya Skills show” from 26th to 27th January, 2017. The conference and show will focus on building upon the successes of the TVET sector in Kenya and strengthening collaboration across the ecosystem. The objectives of this conference are:1. To promote policy debate and dialogue on the threshold issues surrounding the implementation of reforms to the TVET sector in Kenya.2. Strengthen collaborations among TVET partners and stakeholders (both public and private sectors).3. Allow stakeholders from public, private sector, development partners and other groups to show case relevant best practices, services and innovations.4. Improve the image and interest in TVET opportunities among students, youth and the general public.The show which will be running parallel will target students, out of school youth, parents, educators, the general public to experience hands on exhibits and interact with the training provides, employers, career counsellors and others to learn about the opportunities for gaining TVET skills for job readiness. In the Business Climate Strategy paper 2016, the Netherlands embassy proposes to participate in this conference in order to show case what the Dutch government has been doing through Nuffic in the area of skills development. This will also provide an opportunity for promoting the Holland Brand by Holland Branding. The Netherlands embassy would like to provide a “Holland Pavilion” where they will invite:• some of the Dutch organizations/NGOs involved in the TVET sector• some Dutch companies who can display practical skills e.g. KIBO, Solinc, BBrood (to brainstorm more on this)• the NICHE partners at TVET level – SNV, KEWI, Baraka Agric College, Bukura Agric College, Dairy Training Institute, CINOP etc.• Nuffic.
